alert.note: Alert for Coosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 6:22PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Talladega and northwestern Coosa Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 622 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Alpine to Talladega Springs. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sylacauga, Childersburg, Wilsonville, Talladega Springs, Weogufka, Stewartville, Oak Grove, Bon Air, Fayetteville, Winterboro, Strickland Crossroads, Unity, Sycamore, Marble Valley, Lay Lake, Sylacauga Municipal Airport, Overbrook, Shelby Shores, Cedar Creek and Gantts Quarry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
